tweets.text:
The updated 2020 #PropertyFloodResilience EMag is now Live. New case studies and revisits to people who were #flooded in Feb 2020. Positive & inspirational stories of either not being flooded, or quick recoveries. Please retweet!
https://t.co/E6MBrRcX09

More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts: https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ

 #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/3YfkRdZjwe

Thank you very much for the help. We appreciate it 👍 The temporary barrier will be ready to protect properties against rising river level in Bradford-on-Avon early tomorrow morning. https://t.co/hHdZ6fWJeZ https://t.co/Y7dDKjqTIR

tweets.text: Assisting @EnvAgencySW field team with building the barriers today. A precaution against high river levels expected tonight. We are monitoring levels and barriers. #volunteers #partnershipworking @WiltsPrepared @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireRoads @BoATownCouncil https://t.co/uQLFoZuHKM

@Feargal_Sharkey @sascampaigns @SouthernWater @EnvAgency @Ofwat This stinks 😷                           Their ‘penalties’ cost them less than the costs of being responsible and investing to get it sorted! EA know that and just carry on playing along collecting their pocket money and thinking they’ve fixed things.

10:40am, Saturday

Flood alerts in #Surrey, around #Guildford and #Farnham... 

...on the border with #WestSussex: #Horley, #Gatwick and #Crawley... 

Flooding POSSIBLE in both areas...  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/rDz1XHHmkQ

@Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency Also, as if they can claim that that is largely the only time discharges are occuring! Looking at the outfall data so many are discharging more than half the days of the year, there's no way you can class that many as heavy rainfall!

urls.title: River and sea levels in England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: And of course you can check out current #river levels, & in some places, forecast levels via https://t.co/pqBPl2nv8E. All thanks to @EnvAgencyNW measuring stations expertly maintained by @CumbriaRain @AndrewBoothEA & many others. #keyworkers 👏👏👏

Hope @EnvAgency develop backbone & protect environment. Their determination on changes to water abstraction permits needed due to pollution risk from @HS2ltd work pushed back to Jan 2021 “Due to a number of complex issues” 1st sign of a vertebra or an attempt to bury the problem.

A number of #flood alerts are in place across the #NorthWest this evening. Our field teams have been out ensuring watercourses are free of blockages like here at County road #Ormskirk. Make sure you #PrepareActSurvive & sign up to flood warnings ➡️ https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/8VBI24E4ik

1/2 We will soon deploy temporary flood defence barriers in Bradford-on-Avon as the forecast indicates a rise in river level in the early hours of Sunday 4 October (photo from previous deployment). https://t.co/ExadcIhTwy

tweets.text: @billystupid @EnvAgencyYNE Hi Ricard, is this near Wharfebank Business Centre?

Heavy 🌧️ is forecast across the #NorthWest this weekend

If you are travelling & see a road covered in water don't drive through it ❌. It is often deeper than it looks & just 30cm of flowing water is enough to float your car

Stay safe & check your risk 👉https://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/0DJ8tz2TaH

entity.description: This entity includes all conversations about travel and vacation.

tweets.text:
Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE

The UK will experience strong winds and heavy rain across southern parts of England over the next few days

Stay safe and check your flood risk: https://t.co/OkRQsKNblD 
#Floods #Flooding 

https://t.co/jwdzVxEvKC

Unsurprising given today’s 🌧 @EnvAgencyNW have now issued #flood alerts in parts of the #NW. This means we believe that roads & low lying land may #flood from rivers. May need to issue some more in the next few hrs. Pls use https://t.co/vKsRlwd9JU for latest info. #floodaware https://t.co/xt02UuUpYz
There are currently 3 flood warnings in the South West. If you are concerned about flooding,  check https://t.co/QdPKdFg7SD https://t.co/KnFqnsvDKX

Good to see though that @FloodForecast daily #flood guidance has low likelihood of significant impacts in the #NW. But the best adage is of course ‘plan for the worst; Hope for the best’. https://t.co/MqCw0bZEau

🚨 Flooding possible 🚨 

You’ll need this info if you’re in west or south-west London tonight or Sunday 👀⬇️...

... including #Putney, #Chiswick, #Mortlake or #Twickenham... 

Free alerts to your device or to check the latest when it suits: https://t.co/ECXeJErzWW #floodaware https://t.co/eja7KBl08v

tweets.text: @greenbeltsal @tveitdal @Feargal_Sharkey @FT @NorthumbrianH2O @10DowningStreet @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @RiverlevelsUK @CleanIlkley @stellastafford @ExplorerDale @GarsingtonSave @save_our_fields @saverimrose @greenarteries @ElaineCox11 @save_greenbelt @SunderlandUK Left until the last minute of the meeting with no opportunity for any further scrutiny. I wonder why. We are listening and watching every move. No hiding place this time. @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/EPWbuOkOuk

tweets.text: @greenbeltsal @tveitdal @Feargal_Sharkey @FT @NorthumbrianH2O @10DowningStreet @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @RiverlevelsUK @CleanIlkley @stellastafford @ExplorerDale @GarsingtonSave @save_our_fields @saverimrose @greenarteries @ElaineCox11 @save_greenbelt Yesterday’s meeting was due to update us on the meeting held between @SunderlandUK and @NorthumbrianH2O guess what it was cancelled. And it seems it’s “not high on their agenda” 🙄 https://t.co/6PXLn2vQf7

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: 30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Never drive through flood water. What to do during a flood: https://t.co/yOnoPDvQSt https://t.co/YJEHqUeOdx

@picturespete @EnvAgency As we now know ever single river, ever single river in England is polluted.

And the @EnvAgency do what exactly?

All traders and businesses have a legal responsibility to dispose their waste. 

If you're a trader or business, you should take your waste to a licensed commercial facility, arrange a collection or hire a skip. 

#dutyofcare #SCRAPflytipping 
@EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/0CdEOHXFEH
@MervynMj1 @EnvAgencyNW @cheshirepolice Do you mean dumping?🤣🤣

tweets.text: @holmeschap @EnvAgencyNW @cheshirepolice People fly tipping in ditches

Joint operation conducted with @SDC_newsdesk @SDC_CSP @EnvAgencySE @Kent_cc @KPTacOps last night in relation to fly-tipping in the area of Ash. Intel gathered and prosecutions pending! ^PC https://t.co/S0V0duMxWE

Great to see our River Don clean up item in West Boldon hitting the headlines in the @SunderlandEcho when two @EnvAgency field operation officers prepared for the expected bad weather from #StormAlex piece by Tony Gillan / story https://t.co/4CY5MMX0ii #SouthTyneside #Floodaware https://t.co/XIlyXnYYDK

urls.title: Dealing with extreme weather - West Sussex County Council
urls.description: Information and advice about dealing with flooding, heatwave, snow and ice.

tweets.text: A Flood Alert has been issued by @EnvAgency: https://t.co/2BYHZGqtSK for the Western Rother from 10 am, 4th Oct. Please take care of yourself, family & neighbours, especially the vulnerable. See the WSCC website for advice on keeping safe & well: https://t.co/OgbNMO1JlZ https://t.co/EKl6mJvw27
@EnvAgencyNW @cheshirepolice Road gullies never cleaned out. No dredging of waterways.

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - thanks to CEV Judith for the 17:00hrs report. River level 26.7m AOD and @GeodesignB  barriers all fine. @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireRoads @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil, @WiltsPrepared https://t.co/u4MgwbCzRh

Enforcement patrols out yesterday engaging with River users  in the #Cleeve Reach a total of 138 vessels checked ,46 booked unregistered and 16 No name issued .#TeamEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @TobyWillisonEA

Enforcement patrols out yesterday engaging with River users between #Wallingford Town. Moorings to #Benson Lock 22 vessels checked ,11 booked unregistered and 8 no name issued .#TeamEA .@EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @Ang_WaterwaysEA

Due to forecasted heavy rain we have deployed Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & erected temporary defences at Barons Quay. This has been done as a precautionary measure to protect the community from potential high river levels.

Check your #flood risk 👉https://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/F5TNr9XO7f

At the outset, @EnvAgency @HantsIWWildlife & @WinchesterCity @hantsconnect agreed that it was vital that the Durngate Flood Alleviation Scheme was communicated as 'Flood RESILIENCE' not 'Flood defence'. 
@WinchesterCity please honour this in your comms. #winnallmoors is at stake. https://t.co/CFLgSl0XaC

More stormy weather is expected this weekend across southern parts of England

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ 
#Floods #Flooding https://t.co/pjTy4RChyo

tweets.text: @RobRoy1671 @thameswater @EnvAgency Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are looking into it.

Flood risk across the country this weekend. You can check flood warnings for free here (updated every 15 minutes). https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY If you don't know what @EnvAgency's flood warnings mean, see ⬇️ https://t.co/u6wZHLZJ9t

Our field teams are working hard in preparation for heavy rain & high winds this weekend. Here they are in Leyland #Lancashire clearing debris screens to prevent #flooding. 

Are you prepared? Check https://t.co/ce9vZ90qqt or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 for the latest updates https://t.co/YUxScuI1bh

tweets.text: Due to expected increased river levels we are closing flood gates along the River Tees at Yarm (Phase 1), Croft and Neasham Abbey as a precaution this afternoon, and will remain closed over the weekend. #StormAlex https://t.co/pZx7unTQPx

tweets.text: With heavy rain likely it wouldn't harm to check your flood risk once or twice today. Takes less than a minute - https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 #StormAlex https://t.co/cg4AKmftir https://t.co/ukuPhu6y9N

Shame on @thameswater yet again polluting #RuislipNatureReserve, SSSI in London’s largest area of woodland: after 30 years lobbying still falls on deaf ears.  Video shows sewage spewing out of manhole into stream that after 1km flows into Ruislip Lido, &  @EnvAgency does nothing https://t.co/7WY1ZOdesK
